definition[0]: to make someone or something stay on something, and stop them from moving away or escaping
example[0]: We had to hold the tent down with rocks to stop it blowing away.
example[1]: It took three strong men to hold him down.
definition[1]: to prevent the level of something such as prices from rising
example[2]: We will aim to hold down prices.
definition[2]: to succeed in keeping a job for a period of time
example[3]: He’s never held down a job for longer than a few weeks.
definition[3]: to keep people under control or limit their freedom
example[4]: The people were held down for centuries by their conquerors.
definition[4]: to prevent something such as prices from rising
example[5]: To fight inflation, the government held down gasoline prices.
example[6]: Companies are trying to hold down costs and improve efficiency.
definition[5]: to succeed in keeping a job
example[7]: Mr Mills had to hold down a full-time job while attending night school.
